channel.title: Computer's fried
channel.description: So, overnight, my computer mysteriously shut off. In the morning, I asked if anyone had shut off my computer. My mom said "No". So, I just ignored the fact that it was off and pressed the power button. The power button's blue light went on, then the fan started up, after about 2 seconds, it shut off and everything stopped working. I tried to repeat what I did. The computer still wouldn't work. My friend's good with computer's and knows their parts and all of that. I'm just the programmer! :P He said that I must have fried my motherboard because I kept my computer on for so long. I guess my computer just couldn't take anymore. But before I go and dissect my computer, I want to know if there's a way to fix this. I don't want to send it it to an expert because: 1. I don't have that sort of money How do I fix this? :confused:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:5, topic:315105”]It’s a desktop. It’s an eMachines brand Windows Vista. I did see some white plastic plug-ins (With colored wires) detached from some parts in side my tower. I’m not sure if they were already like that or if they’re supposed to be.

If its a desktop, was there a storm previously?

Nope.
I think I’m just gonna salvage what I can from the tower and save up for a Dell that’s NOT from Wal-Mart. (I blame Wal-Mart for pretty much everything :P)[/quote]

lmgtfy.com

LMGTFY

LMGTFY


hmmm
You didnt fry your motherborr… Wait I remeber! I set my computer on fire for hosting Jscape on a 1gb harddrive 1kb graphics (lol) 36mb RAM for 2 years 24/7 I loved that computer ;(

Dell is good to run a lot of processes on. Hp or Gateway are good since they use very little processes and have good RAM. I say get a Dell computer with a intel processor, windows xp, and about 3gb RAM…

Windows 7 > Vista… But 7 and vista are almost alike… If anything get a computer then download Linux and use it over vista… I haven’t tried hosting, or anything on windows 7 but, I heard its almost as bad as vista is.

Its like vista…

If its a desktop, was there a storm previously?

Nope.
I think I’m just gonna salvage what I can from the tower and save up for a Dell that’s NOT from Wal-Mart. (I blame Wal-Mart for pretty much everything :P)
[/quote]
e Machines fail easily… I had one in 2003, and its processor got fried after leaving it on 3 days in a row… I say get a new comp and add ur ram, etc… To it.[/quote]
I’m just going to take your word for it and get a new, better computer.
